definition: disastrous policy
to cover/to overflow/to overturn/to capsize
to remove/to withdraw
rut/track/rhyme/(dialect) way/method
to follow the track of an overturned cart/to repeat a disastrous policy

sentences.english: In an effort not to repeat the same situation with their own children, they have few rules.
sentences.chinese: 为了不使孩子重蹈覆辙，他们很少给孩子立规矩。

sentences.english: Otherwise, you are doomed to repeat it.
sentences.chinese: 否则，你就注定会重蹈覆辙。

sentences.english: I made a blunder, and I tell myself that I'll never make that mistake again.
sentences.chinese: 我犯了个大错，我告诉自己绝不会再重蹈覆辙。

sentences.english: Given the turnover of dynasties in the past, I don't think the Qing could be revived.
sentences.chinese: 过往朝廷覆辙在前，我想大清不还阳的那天了。

sentences.english: In this context, history could repeat itself in the Arab World.
sentences.chinese: 以此类推，阿拉伯世界有可能重蹈覆辙。

sentences.english: We made the mistake of romanticizing villages, and we don't need to make that mistake again.
sentences.chinese: 我们错误地把乡村浪漫化，我们不要再重蹈覆辙。

sentences.english: Acknowledge your role in it so you can avoid repeating it.
sentences.chinese: 承认你对婚姻失败负有责任，从而避免重蹈覆辙。

sentences.english: To reGREt one’s errors to the point of not repeating them is true repentance.
sentences.chinese: 反思自己的过错以至于不重蹈覆辙才是真正的悔悟。

sentences.english: The General met Lincoln’s original fate, the electric chair.
sentences.chinese: 将军重蹈林肯覆辙，坐上了死刑的电椅。

sentences.english: I am the sister of a ten-year-old boy who is busy making them now.
sentences.chinese: 我是一个十岁男孩的姐姐，他正忙于重蹈我的覆辙。

sentences.english: Who can guarantee that we won’t repeat our previous mistakes?
sentences.chinese: 谁敢保证在这件事情上我们不会重蹈覆辙？

sentences.english: Old McDonald gave up smoking for a while, but soon returned to his old ways.
sentences.chinese: 老麦克唐纳戒了一段时间烟，但不久又重蹈覆辙。

sentences.english: By learning about these pitfalls now, you will be able to avoid them in the future.
sentences.chinese: 现在学习到这些缺陷可以避免你在今后重蹈覆辙。

sentences.english: He who does not learn from history dooms to repeat it.
sentences.chinese: 不向历史学习的人注定要重蹈覆辙。

sentences.english: The system is accident-prone, but it rarely makes the same mistake twice.
sentences.chinese: 金融系统容易发生意外，但它很少重蹈覆辙。

definition: to repeat/to follow the same road as
to follow the track of an overturned cart/to repeat a disastrous policy
lit. trailing dust/fig. sb's footsteps/course in life
to learn a lesson from the mistakes of one's predecessor (idiom)
to recur (of events, esp. adverse ones)/to repeat (a performance)
old road/familiar way/beaten track/conventional behavior
to think of the pain when the pain is gone (idiom)/to ponder about a painful experience
to take risks/involved in adventure
wielding the halberd within the household (idiom); internecine strife
lit. to return in a swirl of dust (idiom)/fig. to regroup and come back even stronger/to make a comeback
obstinately clinging to one's course (idiom)/willful/one's own way/dogmatic
to play with fire and get burnt (idiom); fig. to play with evil and suffer the consequences/to get one's fingers burnt
(literary) to be routed (in a war)/to suffer defeat (in sports etc)
internal trouble and outside aggression (idiom); in a mess both domestically and abroad
consigned to eternal damnation/with no hope of reprieve
to repeat a crime/persistent offender
